fields.description:
MuchBetter requires - to have a close loop functionality for phone number
https://goodlpay.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MMPUN/pages/1122140218/UAT+checklist (Phone restrictions section)
 !image-2020-11-03-23-07-26-218.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-11-03-23-10-46-851.png|thumbnail! 

Actual docs: https://goodlpay.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MMPUN/pages/1132822617/MuchBetter+API+and+Integration+Guide

Detailed explanation from Vendor:
"From our side, once a user make a transactions (Any type) to your site, that phone number cannot be changed. 

So whether it be a deposit, or a withdrawal, from your side, once a successful transaction has been made, the phone number cannot be changed. 

In the event that a user gets a new phone number, they should contact your support team, tell you of such, our CSRs can provide a user with a letter of confirmation that we are aware of the new number. "

Important notice!  Operator wants to have phone number field visible but not editable in case we already captured the phone after the first time.

fields.description:
API Doc: [https://hemenode724.com/eng/index.htm|https://hemenode724.com/eng/index.htm]

Questions / Answers


|1. Please confirm how to correctly name you as a Vendor. We think Cuzdan724 would be correct? Please confirm|Cuzdan724|
|2. Do you have separate environments - for Test and for Prod? Please confirm.|It is possible to use Production - just we need to use demo ‘sid’|
|3. What it the highest version of TLS you support for https protocol for your API?|-|
|4. For the Deposit we can see that you have 5 methods and for Withdrawal 3, but there mentioned Withdraw with Papara. Does Papara include Oto and Manual, so means 4 withdrawal methods? Please confirm|5 deposit
3 withdraw|
|5. Do you have any sync-check functionality? Please confirm.|No|
|6. Please explain the user journey for the flows or provide the link where we can read or see that.|They gave this link: [https://payment.hemenode724.com/Payment/Index?i=e27fe538-ded5-452a-92e1-0d9d77f2c3c4|https://payment.hemenode724.com/Payment/Index?i=e27fe538-ded5-452a-92e1-0d9d77f2c3c4]|
|7. Please provide Description on both Turkish and English languages. This is a short text (from 1 to 3-5 sentences long) to explain users what is is method about. It will be shown for user after he selected payment method on the prepare deposit/withdraw page close to your Logo. (In case of our hosted cashier in some placeholder a bit below).|cüzdan724|
|8. Please whitelist our IPs. 
MM Test environment: 
194.44.124.242 
85.9.28.134 - our MQA/Stage

fields.description:
Due to our business wants to remove minor fees from us and put it to user shoulders we need to do adjustments provided by the Vendor.  Vendor request below:

"We'd like to suggest consider specifying payout amounts in the 'charged_amount' field instead of the 'charged_amount_to_send' one in POST /api/coin_withdrawals API requests.
These two parameters let a merchant decide if both the Cryptopay fee and miner fee will be included in the payment amount (so you are not paying miner fees etc) or whether it will be charged from the merchant balance above it.
Please refer to these articles to get a more detailed explanation:
1. https://developers.cryptopay.me/guides/payouts/payout-fees-consideration, and
2. https://developers.cryptopay.me/guides/payouts/create-a-coin-withdrawal

Payout fees consideration
https://developers.cryptopay.me

Create a Coin Withdrawal
https://developers.cryptopay.me
"
Simple words we need to send only "charged_amount" on withdraw instead of current "charged_amount_to_send".
fields.summary: CryptoPay - withdrawal adjustments to remove miner fee

fields.description:
We received the next request from Operator. 

part 1) for development/configuration 
"on the super havale withdraw form we need to add an input area for turkish id number for banks;
Ziraat
Vakıfbank
Halkbank
Albaraka Türk
odeabank
şekerbank
placeholder title is;
BİR YAKININIZIN TC KİMLİK NUMARASI
and input type is only numbers (turkish id number)

those banks has changed their system a bit, they are asking second persons personal id and BİR YAKININIZIN TC KİMLİK NUMARASI is exactly what this means

we need to ask from customers second personal id too, so we need to ad that input for those banks
"
part 2) - for configuration only (developer need to skip it)
"also i will need your help to add this text too 

Para Çekme işleminiz ATM ile sağlanacağı için banka tarafından Ek bir TC numarası istenilmektedir.Herhangi Bir yakınınızın TC numarasını giriniz.

where we explain to them what is new on those banks withdrawal system."

 !image-2021-02-22-14-42-07-268.png|thumbnail!

comments.body:
Fixed in database. Task can be treated as done.
UI changes for extra text area - Operator said we may not do that.

Thanks, Ievgen

fields.description:
Please implement some improvements related to new changes in API provided by Paysera.

/////////////////////Task normal description below///////////////////////////////////

\!\!\!\!\! List of specific things which need to be done
Having discussed with Vendor I can depict a picture of what exactly needs to be done for that task.


# In integration specification [https://developers.paysera.com/en/checkout/integrations/integration-specification|https://developers.paysera.com/en/checkout/integrations/integration-specification]

There is a list of fields - some of them are new. We interested only in two of them at the moment
*personcode* and *buyer_consent*.


!image-20210207-205445.png|width=912,height=655!

2. Please set up buyer_consent as 1. I have agreed that Operator will add that specific text to their UI. Operator will hardcode that in HTML so we can send new value.

3. During request on all bank transfers please send also parameter personcode - it should be taken from a user profile.  In GMCore it is Personal Id.


!image-20210207-205821.png|width=1446,height=428!

4. In callback [https://developers.paysera.com/en/checkout/integrations/integration-callback|https://developers.paysera.com/en/checkout/integrations/integration-callback]
please additionally check two parameters *personcodestatus* and *identification_successful.* 


!image-20210207-210215.png|width=829,height=261!

In case of notification with status=1 will have either pesronsstatus=1 or idendtification_successful  - please make txn successful. 
5. Pay attention in case we still don’t have name, surname parameters in callback which we uses after notification with status=3 to compare names and do auto refund  - please skip that rule otherwise (if they are not empty) it can be left as it is now. Meaning extra check of name can be done afterwards.

6. Still further notifications need to be processed to save all needed information (like IBAN which is needed to be present in paycard to allow withdraw).

7. Important to notice that in most of the cases when our system will send personcode parameter it will be validated on vendor pages on user journey and if it is not ok - user will not be allowed to do payment. Txn will stay in pending on MM side for indefinite time. It should not be declined because user still can finish his payment in a year after that. 

8. In case we still somehow receive name, surname before pesrsoncode status 1 or identification status =1 (there is a small likelihood) we still can use it to make txn successful on notification with status=1. 

At the moment only 2 biggest banks will work that way - Swedbank and Seb bank. Later such quick person code logic should appear on Luminor and later on others. Meantime even for others - if identificationstatus is 1 that means we need to make txn successfyl.

comments.body:
Also I have asked them there is a part of conversation that could be useful as well. 

Technically speaking, what exact improvements should be done in our current flow and integration, @Aurimas could you please advise.
Because I can see there is some extra check (how to do that? what is the reference on the doc for that part) for some banks before call and still not clear what callback we should react on the first one or the second and when?

Martynas Matulevicius, 5:42 PM
@Aurimas

Aurimas, 3:10 PM
It's like always

if you hadn't received all with status=1

you can wait for update with status=3

which specific case we talk about now? Personcode check?

In general if it's about person_code

then now you have name checking

you should extend that

with personcode

as it also confirms it's the same payer you expect

with some payment methods it's possible to make a check from our side, so we won't allow to pass payment

such methods could be identified with the 'callback' : 'identification_status'

if it's 1, this means the user was confirmed on the payment

another thing, which would be good to check with the callback

in case we receive the peroncode confirmation faster then name

then you could follow 'personcodestatus'

which would tell if personcode you provided is the same, or not


I still need some clarity cause I need to explain what to do to my devs.

# So changes witll be done only for 2 payment methods  - which one exactly?
# personcode check - is it applicable for all methods or only for some methods? When this  person check should be done? On what step? Why it is better what we have now? Because it is unique identifier or because we receive that person check with status 1?

# So changes witll be done only for 2 payment methods  - which one exactly?

No, as always, do not focus on something which works now. Follow the parameters you get

In general if it's about person_code
then now you have name checking
you should extend that
with personcode
as it also confirms it's the same payer you expect
with some payment methods it's possible to make a check from our side, so we won't allow to pass payment
such methods could be identified with the 'callback' : 'identification_status'
if it's 1, this means the user was confirmed on the payment
another thing, which would be good to check with the callback
in case we receive the peroncode confirmation faster then name
then you could follow 'personcodestatus'
which would tell if personcode you provided is the same, or not

the names of the methods is just for example and the changes should depend from the parameters, not from the names of the methods

----

# personcode check - is it applicable for all methods or only for some methods? When this  person check should be done? On what step? Why it is better what we have now? Because it is unique identifier or because we receive that person check with status 1?

Again same answer :)

You are not changing the integration, you are extending it. No matter which methods works with it, just add additional feature, which may help identify faster using more ways.

if ($identified === true || $personCodeConfirmed === true || $personName === $gamblerName) \{
//ToDo: here goes magic
}

it's better then only:
if ($personName === $gamblerName) \{
//ToDo: here goes magic
}

because of the reason like:

# Some banks allows to identify it on the payment;
# It might be, that you will get confirmation faster, then names.

As I told, no matter how it works now, do not focus on the specific payments, tomorrow it might change, what would definitely not change - parameters in the documentation and what is sent with a callback.

Tested on *mqa*

Works as expected

!Screenshot_21.png|width=742,height=518!

* In case notification with status=1 has personcodestatus=1 or identification_successful =1  but no account number is saved,  deposit is successful but withdraw is not allowed. Withdraw becomes allowed if another notification with account number is received

Txn ID: 811755058b1111ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

* In case notification with status=1 has personcodestatus=0, 2, 3 or identification_successful =0  flow works as before. Name/surname matching is performed - if name/surname match - > deposit is successful, if don’t match → autorefund is performed 

success: cacfeed68b5d11ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

autorefund: 641089148b5c11ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

* In case notification with status=1 has personcodestatus=0, 2, 3 or identification_successful =0  but no account number received in callback, deposit is in pending until notification with status 3 and account number received. In that case name/surname matching is performed - if name/surname match - > deposit is successful, if don’t match → autorefund is performed

autorefund: 66d719bb8b5e11ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

success: 847a73c3876111ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

autorefund: 75318bdb875b11ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

If account number not received in callback, deposit is in pending until notification with status 3 and account number received. In that case name/surname matching is performed - if name/surname match - > deposit is successful, if don’t match → autorefund is performed 

success: e87ed5ca875411ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

autorefund: 87bec246874f11ebbb6cce74c8bf8ed9000006

No double autorefund performed in case duplicate notification is received

Hello [~accountid:5ddbeeed8389de0cd33491ec] and [~accountid:557058:d58da200-c446-430c-8458-09ef6f7a372a] ,

I tested this feature on ElitCasino stage and i would like to provide my feedback below:

* For{color:#ff5630} *old users*{color}  the behaviour is as follows:

User ID: 3549110

Personal ID: 29036517811

# *Using the GM personal ID*

Added dummy IBAN (TR420006226126516159915147) > added personal ID

!image-20210329-150133.png|width=1628,height=878!

Clicked on withdrawal:

!image-20210329-150145.png|width=1649,height=919!

Successful:

!image-20210329-150156.png|width=1649,height=647!



  *2. Using a second person’s personal ID:*

Added dummy IBAN (TR420006226126516159915147) > added friend’s personal ID

!image-20210329-145732.png|width=1818,height=1009!

Clicked on withdrawal:

!image-20210329-145822.png|width=1795,height=997!

Successful:

!image-20210329-145832.png|width=1753,height=608!



* For {color:#ff5630}*new users*{color}, the flow is the following:

User ID: 3614118

Personal ID: 97772764414

using my personal ID in the friend’s personal ID field:

!image-20210329-151020.png|width=1719,height=1002!



Click withdrawal:

!image-20210329-151028.png|width=1722,height=997!

Success:

!image-20210329-151052.png|width=1788,height=624!

On a side note, can you please let me know why does this feature should work for new users only? Isn’t the personal ID stored already in GM, hence you have this detail for old users too?

fields.description:
Based on the last update from the vendor we have to implement the next flow 

1. we need to switch to new version of Sofort API (online version has been updated)
2  when we receive "untraceable" txn -it is a final status for us and we should treat that as Success.
3. pending_not_credited still should behave as it was - we leave it in pending.

fields.description:
Please investigate if development is needed here. 

Below is the text of the email we received from the Vendor.

Reminder: Online authorisations will be required for refunds

"Dear Customer,

We would like to remind you that Visa and Mastercard issued a mandate which will require online authorisations for all refunds (credit vouchers / purchase returns).

Worldpay were granted an additional waiver for the regions that were originally due to implement by October 2020, allowing us until April 2021 to ensure a smooth transition. Discover has also mandated online refunds in the United States by October 2021.

What do you need to do to prepare?

This change is likely to require significant development and testing resources.

If you have not done so already, we strongly recommend that you assess the impact to your systems and processes as soon as possible.

Development on the Worldwide Payment Gateway (WPG) is complete and will be implemented by April 2021. The WPG guides have been updated to reflect the online refunds mandate, providing information on how online refunds will be processed. This includes additional details on viewing refund outcomes via notifications and order inquiries. You can view the guides by clicking here.

We’ll update our rented terminals to meet Visa and Mastercard’s requirements. If you are using our terminals, you won’t need to make changes
If you are a Worldpay Total or Worldpay Total Mobile user, you may need to upgrade your software. If an upgrade is needed, we’ll send guidance and installation instructions in a separate communication
If you are using your own terminals or integrated point of sale, our Payment Solutions Enablement team will support a level of comfort testing. Please ask your terminal provider(s) whether you need to make changes
If you are using a third party Payment Service Provider (PSP), please contact your PSP to find out if you need to make changes if you have not already done so.
We are updating our LatAm Gateway to prepare for this change and are will begin testing in Febraury. We'll update you on developments as they progress
You will also need a procedure to refund your customers by an alternative means in the case of a refund failing
Failure to meet these requirements may cause increased cardholder complaints, chargebacks, and non-compliance assessments from Visa and Mastercard.

Key dates

Card Scheme

Region

Effective date

Visa

US

April 2021

Canada

LAC

APAC (including Japan)

Europe, UK & ROI

22 April 2022

Discover

US

15 October 2021

Diners

UK

April 2022

Mastercard

All (except Europe, UK and ROI)

Aligned with Visa

Europe, UK and ROI

Aligned with Visa



Why are Visa and Mastercard requiring online authorisations for refunds?

With cardholders accessing real-time online banking apps 24/7, they are becoming more aware of the speed that purchase information appears on their accounts. They are also increasingly aware that refund information is not updated at the same speed, so this change will benefit cardholders by letting them see this information in real time.

More Information

For more information, please contact your Relationship Manager or Corporate Support Manager.

Worldpay from FIS
 "
fields.summary: WP Refunds - Online authorisations will be required for refunds - to investigate

comments.body:
# From the point of view of documentation, it seems that nothing needs to be done:

!image-20210222-130030.png|width=903,height=744!

2. Can ask the vendor if you need to do something from the client's point of view.
Thank you, [~accountid:5c6a794ab980e54d9e7bfee7].

Asked Vendor to confirm 


[https://serviceportal.worldpay.com/CaseDetails?cid=07105978|https://serviceportal.worldpay.com/CaseDetails?cid=07105978]

Will keep everybody posted.

I have asked vendor and received strange reply 

”Hi Ievgen,

Your submission to Worldpay won't change however for refunds you will either receive an auth or refund failed from us so we want to set your expectation.

Kind regards,

Dan”


Will continue asking them.

The last comment from Vendor was 



|From Daniel Kane on  01/03/2021, 15:17|
|Hi Ievgen,
That depends if you want to receive the additional information from us. I can add a property to your merchant code so we can give you the auth code or failed reason in our response.
You don't need to change anything the above information would be for your benefit.
Kind regards,
Dan|

Wrote to the Vendor again
[https://serviceportal.worldpay.com/CaseDetails?cid=07168403|https://serviceportal.worldpay.com/CaseDetails?cid=07168403]

Nothing is required at the moment. They can return us some extra information about reason why refund was failed. But that will not prevent of failing refund. 
I contacted vendor again to clarify if there is sense to do anything on that matter. But even now quite clear we can do nothing to change that. I am closing the task.


!image-20210406-183228.png|width=1251,height=370!

Thanks, Ievgen

fields.description:
*As* a MM Business, *I want* to have Volt Connect (cash management tool) implemented, *so that* will give us the ability to control cash transferring on banks side same way as Sofort or Fintec have with their automatic/manual reconcilation approaches. 

_Tech details_: 
Api doc: [https://docs.volt.io/docs/connect/welcome_to_connect/|https://docs.volt.io/docs/connect/welcome_to_connect/] 

*Acceptance criteria:* 

* For consider Volt Connect might be configured for any country on Vendor side so our Volt integration should always be able to process two additional notifications provided by Volt Connect (MoneyReceived and standard Fail notification) in a proper way similar to Fintec behaviour (business flow in the diagram attached and in the documentation) 
* we received notification with status COMPLETE, make txn successful (_just to connect with related feature - in the related task after checkbox activated we leave txn not Succesful but in Pending status_), then receive a status "RECEIVED" so txn should stay in Successful state
*  we received notification with status COMPLETE, make txn successful, if then we receive notification that money transfer failed after that our system should fail txn on MM side
* after txn became Failed there should be an automatic feature to change status to success if we receive a notification with the status "RECEIVED" after.

[^Volt Flow.xlsx]


*Out of scope*: 
- toggle feature described in [https://everymatrix.atlassian.net/browse/MON-11594|https://everymatrix.atlassian.net/browse/MON-11594|smart-link]
fields.summary: Extend Volt integration with Volt Connect feature

fields.description:
*As a* MM business *I want* to have a toggle feature configurable per merchant that allows leaving txns in Pending status on our side after receiving "Completed" notification, *all the rest flow should stay the same*, 
*so that* will give us the benefit that our merchants will have an option to choose if to take the financial risk of txn being or not being reconciled in proper time. 

*Acceptance criteria:*

* there should be a toggle control (checkbox in UCS per merchant  with text "IsFinancialApprovalRequired")
* by default it is not selected
* if it is selected  flow should work the way that txn after Complete notification stays in pending and only after next financial notifications (Recieved and standard Fail) txn can change status to success or fail accordingly.
* if it is not selected - system automatically set txn status to success first time when we receive "Completed" notification

Technical details:

* For the full business flow picture please check business flow diagram in the attachment below
 

[^Volt Flow.xlsx]

fields.description:
I as a Client I want to have extra parameter "urgency" with the constant default value "urgent" sent in all Paysera bank transfer requests only to vendor so that will speed up processing of some part of bank transfer txns and made them with instant speed. 

Acceptance criteria: 
 - to check if new parameter with value "urgent" sent in log during the API call to vendor for bank transfer methods only all the rest methods should stay as they were. 

Details:
API docs: https://developers.paysera.com/lt/transfer/api-spec

 !image-2021-07-05-11-54-29-908.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-07-05-11-56-16-344.png|thumbnail! 

Information for QA: 
 - full testing on Stage most likely unavailable due to Paysera test env retrictions so it is enough to check common flow if it does not fail, all the rest testing will happen on Prod
fields.summary: Paysera - to extend withdraw request for all bank transfer methods with new parameter "urgency"

fields.description:
Vendor presented to us a new API for invoice calls. That thing similar to channels which we have implemented at the moment but with a small difference in behavior.  It's mostly aimed to e-commerce usage where exact amount is needed.  Here is available multiple payments in scope of 30 minutes of one invoice, underpay, overpay use-cases with ability to refund any chunk of payment we need.
Please kindly implement this as a separate method. Logo will be the same. 

API docs: https://docs.orbpay.com/docs/intro-to-invoices-2 Password available on the corresponding confluence page.
fields.summary: OrbPay - new payment method to implement - invoices.

4. Setup monitoring.

* MMMQS-DB-VL001
* MMRBMQS1-S1LG
* MMRBMQS2-S1LG
* MMRBMQS3-S1LG

fields.description:
According to Vendor request for getting payment methods should be dynamic because it brings new limits each time and hide/show non-available options for user after each new transaction.
So please remove cashing here.

*Issue limits:*
It was found that we do not take limits for the case when UBO min limit allow 50 and CUPIS allows 100. 
We should use 100 but using 50 instead. And that is wrong.

fields.description:
Please confirm Cupis WithdrawApiCheck works as expected.
Please provide a list of checks we do on our side. And what we return to vendor.
Please retest to be sure it is working good. 



Please fix the notification handling for WithdrawCheck to return “reject“ content.

fields.description:
Please implement new payment vendor TcKasa. This is requested by Betdoksan Operator and it is their online inhouse vendor which aimed to replace existing Offline.BetdoksanVip.Papara and Offline.BetdoksanVip.Havale with corresponding analogues. 
TcKasa contains TcKasa.VipPapara and TcKasa.VipHavale methods both for deposit and withdraw.

Documentation below: 

 [^api doc tckasa ver01.pdf] 

deposit url: http://tckasa.com/Api/AccountTransaction/Deposit

draw url: http://tckasa.com/Api/AccountTransaction/Draw

userName: user_api_tckasa
Password: 5F272243-BAF5-443A-B0AA-61231E785613
Key: 2D62F813-5A92-48EB-8CBD-7B26CAFEB47F

Non-3D deposit, 3D deposit and withdraw transactions were made. Non-3D and 3D deposits are working fine, but sync check of refund of 3D transaction sends request to non-3D vendor URL. For withdraws, we should change our response on vendor’s notification to receive a second, successful notification. Now withdraws are stuck on pending notification status.

Deposit 3D: 2d3fe3c11ce511ebab05801844f29668001008

Withdraw: 35ea99ca1ce811ebab05801844f29668001008

Those two issues will be fixed in scope of other task, everything else works as expected.

fields.description:
Please do analysis if we are ok with new requirements provided by Vendor and fix if we are not. 

"Dear Merchant,

Please be aware that we are planning to apply 3DSv2 billing and shipping address validations on 28.10.2020 in compliance with the regulations stated in the EMVCo docs.
For more information please check our API Documentation
https://e-comprocessing.github.io/gateway-api-docs/ billing_address and shipping_address for 3D transactions.

It is highly recommended to pay attention specially to the limitations which will be applied to billing_address and shipping_address params:

- Primary address (address1), the field length is limited to 150 chars only for async 3DS transactions that are using the 3DSv2 authentication protocol.

- The field that holds the zip code is limited to 16 chars only for async 3DS transactions that are using the 3DSv2 authentication protocol.

- The field that holds the city is limited to 50 chars only for async 3DS transactions that are using the 3DSv2 authentication protocol.

- The field that holds the country state is limited to 3 chars only for async 3DS transactions that are using the 3DSv2 authentication protocol.

Please note that the transactions that don't follow these guidelines may be declined. 
We offer our sincere apologies for the inconvenience this may cause. If you have any questions regarding this issue please contact us at Tech-Support@e-comprocessing.com

Best regards, 

Amir Fasihani
Web Integration & IT Support Engineer



T: +35924487265
E: amir.fasihani@e-comprocessing.com
W: www.e-comprocessing.com"
fields.summary: E-comprocessing - 3DSv2 billing and shipping address validations starts from 28.10.2020
